Key Match Events: India beat England by 68 runs in the ICC T20 World Cup 2024 semifinal.
Rohit Sharma scored 57 runs for India.
Chris Jordan took 3 wickets for 37 runs for England.
Harry Brook scored 25 runs for England.
Kuldeep Yadav took 3 wickets for 19 runs for India.
Axar Patel was named Player of the Match for his bowling performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma expressed satisfaction with the team's performance and adaptation to challenging conditions.
Jos Buttler acknowledged that India outplayed England and praised his team's efforts despite the loss.
Axar Patel discussed his strategy of bowling slower on a slow wicket, which contributed to his success.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Guyana National Stadium, Providence.
India will face South Africa in the T20 World Cup final.
Both India and South Africa are unbeaten in the tournament so far.
